TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit MSBuild extends Microsoft.Build.Tasks.TaskExtension

Attribute.AttributeName: Microsoft.Build.Framework.RunInMTA

Docs.summary: Implements the MSBuild task. Use the MSBuild element in your project file to create and execute this task. For usage and parameter information, see [MSBuild Task](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/76577f6c-7669-44ad-a840-363e37a04d34).

remarks.format:
## Remarks This class implements the "MSBuild" task, which hands off child project files to the MSBuild engine to be built.
Marked RunInMTA because there is no reason MSBuild tasks should run on a thread other than that of the RequestBuilder which spawned them.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When you specify this parameter, it is functionally equivalent to setting properties that have the **/property** switch when you build with .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether the [!INCLUDE[vstecmsbuild](~/includes/vstecmsbuild-md.md)] task invokes each target in the list passed to [!INCLUDE[vstecmsbuild](~/includes/vstecmsbuild-md.md)] one at a time, instead of at the same time.
Docs.value: if the [!INCLUDE[vstecmsbuild](~/includes/vstecmsbuild-md.md)] task invokes each target in the list passed to [!INCLUDE[vstecmsbuild](~/includes/vstecmsbuild-md.md)] one at a time; if the [!INCLUDE[vstecmsbuild](~/includes/vstecmsbuild-md.md)] task invokes all targets in the list at the same time.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Setting this property to `true` guarantees that subsequent targets are invoked even if previously invoked targets failed. Otherwise, a build error would stop invocation of all subsequent targets. The default value is `false`.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If project files that do not exist on the disk are not skipped, they will cause a build error.

Attribute.AttributeName: Microsoft.Build.Framework.Output

Docs.summary: Returns the outputs of the built targets from all the project files. Only the outputs from the targets that were specified are returned, not any outputs that may exist on targets that those targets depend on.
Docs.value: The outputs of the built targets from all the project files.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the target or targets to build in the project files. Use a semicolon to separate a list of target names.
Docs.value: The target or targets to build in the project files.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If no targets are specified in the `MSBuild` task, the default targets specified in the project files are built.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The scope of built targets in the cash is (ProjectFileName, GlobalProperties)[TargetNames] as a list of build items.
This property is no longer used in version 4.0.
